title: How to Make Red Lentil Soup

steps.headline: Check your refrigerator and pantry.
steps.description: You may have some or most of the ingredients that you will need. The necessary ingredients are pretty basic, which makes this an easy and cost-effective soup to make.

steps.headline: Peel and cut up the garlic and onion.
steps.description: You'll want both the garlic and onion to be finely chopped. This is a tedious process, but it can be done while you're waiting for the lentils and chicken stock to boil.

steps.headline: Add the lentils and chicken or vegetable stock to the pot.
steps.description: Put the pot over the stove on medium to high heat. Once the lentils and stock begin to boil (the liquid makes big bubbles), lower the heat to a simmer. The lentils will be done when they are soft and rise to the top of the liquid.

steps.headline: Combine the chopped onion and garlic with some olive oil (a little goes a long way).
steps.description: Cook until the water comes out of them (the onions will begin to look transparent), but don't put the heat on so high that they brown because this will alter the taste of your soup.

steps.headline: Add spices to taste.
steps.description: If you're not a fan of cayenne pepper, salt and black pepper will work fine on their own.

steps.headline: When the garlic and onion are fully cooked, transfer them from the pan into the pot with the lentils and chicken or vegetable stock.
steps.description: Stir and do a taste test. If it needs more spices, add them to the broth.

steps.headline: Cut the lemon in half and squeeze the juice.
steps.description: After a couple of minutes of letting all the ingredients combine in the pot, add the lemon juice. Let the juice mingle with the soup.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: After a couple of minutes of letting the lemon juice infuse through the soup, the soup will be ready to eat.

methods.name: Herbs and spice red lentil soup

steps.headline: Heat oil in large, heavy-bottomed saucepan over medium heat.
Add onion and cook, stirring about 5 minutes or until soft.
Add garlic, carrots, black pepper, hot red pepper flakes, oregano and rosemary; cook, stirring, about 2 minutes more.
Add lentils and stock.
steps.description: Bring to a boil over high heat; reduce heat to low and simmer, partially, covered, until lentils are soft and falling apart, about 15 to 20 minutes.

steps.headline: Add lemon juice, salt and pepper.
Serve hot soup in shallow bowls sprinkled with feta and chopped parsley.

text: Basic red lentil soup Check your refrigerator and pantry. You may have some or most of the ingredients that you will need. The necessary ingredients are pretty basic, which makes this an easy and cost-effective soup to make. Peel and cut up the garlic and onion. You'll want both the garlic and onion to be finely chopped. This is a tedious process, but it can be done while you're waiting for the lentils and chicken stock to boil. Add the lentils and chicken or vegetable stock to the pot. Put the pot over the stove on medium to high heat. Once the lentils and stock begin to boil (the liquid makes big bubbles), lower the heat to a simmer. The lentils will be done when they are soft and rise to the top of the liquid. Combine the chopped onion and garlic with some olive oil (a little goes a long way). Cook until the water comes out of them (the onions will begin to look transparent), but don't put the heat on so high that they brown because this will alter the taste of your soup. Add spices to taste. If you're not a fan of cayenne pepper, salt and black pepper will work fine on their own. When the garlic and onion are fully cooked, transfer them from the pan into the pot with the lentils and chicken or vegetable stock. Stir and do a taste test. If it needs more spices, add them to the broth. Cut the lemon in half and squeeze the juice. After a couple of minutes of letting all the ingredients combine in the pot, add the lemon juice. Let the juice mingle with the soup. Serve. After a couple of minutes of letting the lemon juice infuse through the soup, the soup will be ready to eat. Herbs and spice red lentil soup Heat oil in large, heavy-bottomed saucepan over medium heat.  Add onion and cook, stirring about 5 minutes or until soft.  Add garlic, carrots, black pepper, hot red pepper flakes, oregano and rosemary; cook, stirring, about 2 minutes more.  Add lentils and stock. Bring to a boil over high heat; reduce heat to low and simmer, partially, covered, until lentils are soft and falling apart, about 15 to 20 minutes. Add lemon juice, salt and pepper.  Serve hot soup in shallow bowls sprinkled with feta and chopped parsley.
